title.narrative: PROTECTING CHILDREN FROM HARM

description.narrative: By 2016 duty bearers in the protection sector and rights holders have knowledge and skills to protect children from harm and violence, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Evaluation And Research. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2016 all boys and girls from the poorest communities are accessing pre-school and early stimulation opportunities, are benefiting from positive child-centered approaches at school and are benefitting from law and polices that protect them from neglect, violence, exploitation and discrimination.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2016 duty bearers in the protection sector and rights holders have knowledge and skills to protect children from harm andviolence

description.narrative: The Eastern Caribbean continues to wrestle with incidences of sexual abuse and child neglect. Nevertheless significant strides continued to be made towards the better protection of children from pre-secondary school. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:11/01/2017

title.narrative: of newly sensitized professionals (medical/ social workers/ police, religious leaders/media/ coaches who have increased knowledge on identifying and responding to all forms of violence against boys and girls

actual.value: 2016:Of the countries that did sensitization workshops for professional, St Vincent and the Grenadines were able to reach about 40 % of its ECD practitioners, Dominica reached 100% of its coaches and PE teachers, Turks and Caicos reached approximately 60 percent of its religious leaders. title.narrative: % of boys and girls 8-11 years in 8 countries at CFS who know what to do in the event of sexual abuse

baseline.value: 93% B'dos, Anguilla 82%, Antigua 93%, D'ca 91%, St. Lucia 92%, Grenda 82% (2012), St. Vincent (84%), St. Kitts & Nevis 80%

actual.value: 2016:Key partnerships have been developed with MoE and CP departments. An additional. 2000 children (pre-primary and secondary) have been sensitized on touching and non-touching forms of abuse

title.narrative: /% of print media reports on chidlren's issues that are following ethical guidelines for reporting on chidl protection issues

baseline.value: Dominica 95%, St. Lucia 82%, St. Vincent 93%, Trinidad 42%

actual.value: 2016:Media code has been developed on which journalists will be sensitized in an effort to increase quality of reporting

title.narrative: % of men and woemn in 5 countries who have knowledge about what is child abuse, how to prevent and how to respond

actual.value: 2016:All countries continued public awareness of CSA through the BTS media campaign. Trinidad reached about 80% of its population though their carnival child abuse ads.
